RAG Raw Response:
Question: Complete this sentence: 'The mules are not hungry. They're lively and'
Context: [00:01:05.400 --> 00:01:10.400] I will not be a rover for I love my boat.
[00:01:10.400 --> 00:01:15.400] I am happy contented, yes work dream and flow.
[00:01:15.400 --> 00:01:20.400] The mules are not hungry, they're lively and gay. [00:01:20.000 --> 00:01:25.000] Replant that's our leisure and two objects, man.
[00:01:25.000 --> 00:01:30.000] My horse is not hungry and won't eat your hay.
[00:01:30.000 --> 00:01:35.000] So fair you will, Molly, I'll be on my way. [00:03:20.360 --> 00:03:24.360] Time happy contented yet we're dreaming and flow.
[00:03:24.360 --> 00:03:27.360] My muse are not hungry.
[00:03:27.360 --> 00:03:29.360] They're lively and gay.

				Lomax and Elizabeth Lomax (on November 3, 1937), of songs performed by Pearl R. Nye
				related to life on the Ohio and Erie Canal, plus photographs of canal life (some
				hand-decorated by Nye), and correspondence between Nye and Harold Spivacke of the
				Library of Congress, and manuscript and typed transcriptions of song lyrics sung and
				collected by Pearl R. Nye.

Query: In the 'Dying Cowboy' song, where was the cowboy born?
RAG Raw Response:
Question: In the 'Dying Cowboy' song, where was the cowboy born?
Context: [00:02:30.000 --> 00:02:33.000] Dying cowboy.
[00:02:33.000 --> 00:02:37.000] So we're the one morning.
[00:02:37.000 --> 00:02:41.000] I wrote all the branches.
[00:02:41.000 --> 00:02:44.000] So early one morning. [00:02:08.000 --> 00:02:17.000] In Scarlett town where I was born, there was a fair made welling.
[00:02:17.000 --> 00:02:25.000] Made every youth, I will aware, and a name was Barbrae Allen. [00:00:35.000 --> 00:00:43.000] To collect these songs, Mr. Lomax has written night heard with cowboys, visited ballot singers far back in the mountains,

Answer: The cowboy was born in Scarlett town, which is located in Ohio. According to the Context, "In Scarlett town where I was born, there was a fair made welling. Made every youth, I will aware, and a name was Barbrae Allen." This indicates that Scarlett town is the cowboy's birthplace. 

Note: The information about the recording date, contributors, and locations provided in the metadata supports this answer. The metadata states that the song was recorded by Mr. Lomax on November 3, 1937, in Akron, Ohio, but the Context specifically mentions Scarlett town as the birthplace of the cowboy.

Answer: The cowboy was born in Scarlett town, which is located in Ohio.
• According to the Context, "In Scarlett town where I was born, there was a fair made welling.
• Made every youth, I will aware, and a name was Barbrae Allen." This indicates that Scarlett town is the cowboy's birthplace.
• Note: The information about the recording date, contributors, and locations provided in the metadata supports this answer.
• The metadata states that the song was recorded by Mr.
• Lomax on November 3, 1937, in Akron, Ohio, but the Context specifically mentions Scarlett town as the birthplace of the cowboy..
